description:
You are given an integer array arr. You can choose a set of integers and remove all the occurrences of these integers in the array.

Return the minimum size of the set so that at least half of the integers of the array are removed.

Input Format:
An integer array

Ouput Format:
A single integer which is the minimum size of the set so that at least half of the integers of the array are removed.

### Example 1 

### Input
```CPP
 arr = [3,3,3,3,5,5,5,2,2,7]
``` 
### Output 
```CPP 
2
``` 
#### Explanation:
 Choosing {3,7} will make the new array [5,5,5,2,2] which has size 5 (i.e equal to half of the size of the old array).
Possible sets of size 2 are {3,5},{3,2},{5,2}.
Choosing set {2,7} is not possible as it will make the new array [3,3,3,3,5,5,5] which has a size greater than half of the size of the old array.




### Example 2 

### Input
```CPP
arr = [7,7,7,7,7,7]
``` 
### Output 
```CPP 
1
``` 
#### Explanation:
The only possible set you can choose is {7}. This will make the new array empty.

### Constraints:

* 2 <= arr.length <= 105
* arr.length is even.
* 1 <= arr[i] <= 105
title: Divide the Array
